title: An Efficient Membership Inference Attack for the Diffusion Model by Proximal Initialization. (arXiv:2305.18355v1 [cs.SD])
abstract: Recently, diffusion models have achieved remarkable success in generating tasks, including image and audio generation. However, like other generative models, diffusion models are prone to privacy issues. In this paper, we propose an efficient query-based membership inference attack (MIA), namely Proximal Initialization Attack (PIA), which utilizes groundtruth trajectory obtained by $\epsilon$ initialized in $t=0$ and predicted point to infer memberships. Experimental results indicate that the proposed method can achieve competitive performance with only two queries on both discrete-time and continuous-time diffusion models. Moreover, previous works on the privacy of diffusion models have focused on vision tasks without considering audio tasks. Therefore, we also explore the robustness of diffusion models to MIA in the text-to-speech (TTS) task, which is an audio generation task. To the best of our knowledge, this work is the first to study the robustness of diffusion models to MIA in t

Title: An Efficient Membership Inference Attack for the Diffusion Model by Proximal Initialization. (arXiv:2305.18355v1 [cs.SD])
Abstract: Recently, diffusion models have achieved remarkable success in generating tasks, including image and audio generation. However, like other generative models, diffusion models are prone to privacy issues. In this paper, we propose an efficient query-based membership inference attack (MIA), namely Proximal Initialization Attack (PIA), which utilizes groundtruth trajectory obtained by $\epsilon$ initialized in $t=0$ and predicted point to infer memberships. Experimental results indicate that the proposed method can achieve competitive performance with only two queries on both discrete-time and continuous-time diffusion models. Moreover, previous works on the privacy of diffusion models have focused on vision tasks without considering audio tasks. Therefore, we also explore the robustness of diffusion models to MIA in the text-to-speech (TTS) task, which is an audio generation task. To the best of our knowledge, this work is the first to study the robustness of diffusion models to MIA in t
translated_abstract: 近年来，扩散模型在图像和音频生成等任务中取得了巨大的成功。然而，与其他生成模型一样，扩散模型容易存在隐私问题。在本文中，我们提出了一种高效的基于查询的成员推断攻击方法，称为近端初始化攻击（PIA），它利用由$\epsilon$在$t=0$时初始化的实际轨迹和预测点来推断成员资格。实验结果表明，该方法在离散时间和连续时间的扩散模型上只需两个查询即可实现有竞争力的性能。此外，以往关于扩散模型隐私的研究都集中在视觉任务，没有考虑到音频任务。因此，我们还在文本转语音（TTS）任务中探讨了扩散模型对会员推断攻击的鲁棒性。据我们所知，这是第一篇研究扩散模型鲁棒性的文章。
tldr: 本文提出了一种基于查询的成员推断攻击方法PIA，利用实际轨迹和预测点来推断成员资格。此方法仅需两个查询即可在离散时间和连续时间的扩散模型上实现有竞争力的性能。文章探讨了扩散模型在音频任务中对会员推断攻击的鲁棒性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a query-based membership inference attack method called PIA, which utilizes groundtruth trajectory and predicted point to infer memberships, achieving competitive performance with only two queries on both discrete-time and continuous-time diffusion models. The study also explores the diffusion model's robustness to membership inference attacks in audio tasks.
